newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela foreign reserves rise to $16.086 bln.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela foreign reserves rise to $16.086 bln.

text.p: Venezuela's total foreign reserves rose $463 million, or 3.0 percent, in the week to June 2, to $16.086 billion, according to figures released by the central bank.
Reserves were up from $15.623 billion on May 26, the bank's latest weekly bulletin of indicators showed.
Since the start of the year, reserves have risen $907 million, or 6.0 percent.
Reserves rose $5.5 billion, or 57 percent, last year, to $15.179 billion. Government officials have forecast they will grow to $20 billion by the end of 1997.
